snippet.textDisplay: Foldable displays are useless without proper integration with the software. These devices are going to be so incredibly glitchy and unwieldy on Windows as to make them borderline useless. As someone who just went from a windows laptop to an iPad Pro, I can safely say that a Windows device of any kind of simply out of the question until they can better integrate the hardware into the software.
snippet.textOriginal: Foldable displays are useless without proper integration with the software. These devices are going to be so incredibly glitchy and unwieldy on Windows as to make them borderline useless. As someone who just went from a windows laptop to an iPad Pro, I can safely say that a Windows device of any kind of simply out of the question until they can better integrate the hardware into the software.

snippet.textDisplay:
After switching from a touchscreen phone with hardware buttons, to a phone that lacks them... I will never again underestimate the value of having physical buttons for things. Not having them is MADDENING. It's so irritating that basic functionality might move or disappear, based on the whim (or competence) of the individual app developers. And I hate having to look at the screen to see where something is, because my hand cannot find the button by feel alone.

Because of this, I'm never gonna get one of these gimmicky things. It's a solution to a problem that doesn't exist.
snippet.textOriginal:
After switching from a touchscreen phone with hardware buttons, to a phone that lacks them... I will never again underestimate the value of having physical buttons for things. Not having them is MADDENING. It's so irritating that basic functionality might move or disappear, based on the whim (or competence) of the individual app developers. And I hate having to look at the screen to see where something is, because my hand cannot find the button by feel alone.

Because of this, I'm never gonna get one of these gimmicky things. It's a solution to a problem that doesn't exist.

snippet.textDisplay: If you've been a laptop user for a few years you know that things that bind like hinges, wiring, and such tend to fail in due time. Often in less time than is comfortable to the end user. I'm satisfied that if long term use is in your plans actually folding a screen is not the best idea anyone ever came up with though if you get a new laptop yearly it may not matter all that much to you.
snippet.textOriginal: If you've been a laptop user for a few years you know that things that bind like hinges, wiring, and such tend to fail in due time. Often in less time than is comfortable to the end user. I'm satisfied that if long term use is in your plans actually folding a screen is not the best idea anyone ever came up with though if you get a new laptop yearly it may not matter all that much to you.

snippet.textDisplay: But what is the screen made of? Plastic? It will look like trash in a few months and good luck using a screen protector. That one with the non folding dual screen will be the best one shown here just because it's harder to scratch glass. Unless they create an institution of easily replaceable screens, wear and tear will be its absolute downfall.

snippet.textDisplay: So... an oversized tablet with laptop hardware that can fold like a laptop... But as it's supposed to be a laptop it still needs a keyboard, so it's less portable than a laptop.... So it's a pretty powerful, slightly more portable tablet. So even looking at it from that angle, it being a better tablet, I'd still take the laptop if I need something portable...
snippet.textOriginal: So... an oversized tablet with laptop hardware that can fold like a laptop... But as it's supposed to be a laptop it still needs a keyboard, so it's less portable than a laptop.... So it's a pretty powerful, slightly more portable tablet. snippet.textDisplay: This would be called a folding tablet, and something I'm not interested in. The point of laptops is to have the portability of a tablet or phone but with a more full and physical machine experience. Any tablet can connect bluetooth mice and keyboards. This isn't special outside of a folding screen which is still something that hasn't been perfected anyway. I'm sure this has it's niche market, like many things do, but I do not see many people wanting this.
snippet.textOriginal: This would be called a folding tablet, and something I'm not interested in. The point of laptops is to have the portability of a tablet or phone but with a more full and physical machine experience. Any tablet can connect bluetooth mice and keyboards. This isn't special outside of a folding screen which is still something that hasn't been perfected anyway. I'm sure this has it's niche market, like many things do, but I do not see many people wanting this.

snippet.textDisplay:
I want a foldable laptop, but only if it has the same aspect ratio on both screens as it has with the screen combined - like A4 paper.


I'd also want it to come with proper color calibration tools so I could get very close to what-you-see-is-what-gets-printed.


My main use case for a laptop right now is to turn it over and use the screen (~95% of my time), rather than carry it around (~5% of the time). Being able to fold it up so the screen is larger when I don't need portability, would be nice.
snippet.textOriginal:

My main use case for a laptop right now is to turn it over and use the screen (~95% of my time), rather than carry it around (~5% of the time). Being able to fold it up so the screen is larger when I don't need portability, would be nice.
